The silver city unites and two become one in this dark brown Porter. Aromas of chocolate, berry fruit and roastiness rise.
Scottish raspberries and blackcurrants interplay with roasty, nutty and dark chocolate notes. A complex, layered Porter with a juicy sweet delivery, complemented by an underlying gentle bitterness and subtle spice from the hops. Good neighbours making good beer for our global neighbourhood.

Neighbourhood - East-side beer brotherhood.

174.name: Clown King (Fanzine edition)
174.desc:
Roll up, the King is back. And he's brimming with bitter-sweet bold flavours. Clown King delivers chewy toffee malt, overlaid with a driving bitterness, sticky fruit character, and surprisingly light finale.


Part of the Fanzine beer club

175.name: Baltic Bandit
175.desc:
Slip Anchor and set sail with this silky smooth Porter. Toffee and chocolate on the nose.
Delivering a rich and chewy decadent cargo. Melted caramel and dark chocolate layer onto a rich dark oaky hull.
Baltic Bandit - Fathom the sticky depths.

A Fanzine beer.

176.name: Baltic Fleet
176.desc:
From day one we’ve collaborated. Listening to our customers and working with our peers. Honing our art abd soreading the word. Our series of pan-european collaborations help celebrate that spirit. 

Batten down the hatches for this Baltic Porter, we’re about to slip anchor. All hands on deck for a payload of dark fruit. Plum and black currant mix with notes of raisin, African coffee and subtle dark chocolate. 

Craft beer spoken here.

177.name: Dogtoberfest
177.desc:
A traditional fest-style lager, straight out of Bavaria. A little more subtle than your average oompah band, this malt-forward lager uses Munich and Vienna malts to create a rich tapestry of Maillaird flavour and aroma. Bread crust, cracker and pretzel-like notes intertwine with a toasty bassline. Caramalt adds a touch of cookie crust flavour, without veering into sweetness, while Tettnang hops infuse a subtle spice.

Part of the Fanzine club

178.name: Abstrakt AB:25
178.desc: A super-smooth, full-bodied chewy-as-hell barley wine. Our latest concept brew has spent six months drawing flavour from bourbon barrels.

179.name: Origami Orangutan
179.desc:
A big, classic American IPA, infused with tangerine, citrus peel, pine dust, tropical fruit notes, fresh cut grass and an ever present tangerine character keep things light, with bursts of caramel malt, a pungent bitter resin baseline and an ABV of 8.5% giving weight to this heavy duty fruity IPA.

Brewed for the Fanzine beer club.

180.name: King of Eights V3 - Triple Dry-Hop Edition
180.desc: Good things come in threes. Three rounds of dry-hopping crank up the pungent hop aromas to Defcon I. Melon, pine, mango, pineapple and lemon peel unite on a super smooth base that barely registers any bitterness.

181.name: Tropic Thunder
181.desc:
Tropic Thunder is the winner of HomeBrewDog; the brainchild of Tom Doyle, this beer was the highest rated of the 307 beers that were tasted.

Tropic Thunder packs cocoa powder and fresh espresso on the nose, followed by a dry and roasty overload – bitter chocolate, toast crust, and burnt toffee with a light charred note and a finish softened by bittersweet orange peel..

182.name: Cloud Cartel
182.desc:
A session-strength New England IPA, Cloud Cartel rigs an explosive dry-hop aroma from Huell Melon, Ariana and Cascade. Up-front flavours of melon, lime peel and peach, with a ruby grapefruit undercurrent, crammed in courtesy of delicate hop oils. As ever, oats and wheat augment a velvet mouthfeel, redolent of mango and pineapple juice, finishing light and zesty. 

Cloud Cartel - a hop-smuggling operation.

183.name: Brutalist
183.desc: Pop the cork on this Brut IPA. German and American hops unite to give a subtle sauvignon blanc and fruity flavour profile. Stone fruits duke it out with apricot and peach winning the day, followed by a deft touch of grass and gooseberry to finish. A delicate effervescence and white wine character deliver this brutalist into polite society.

184.name: Passionista
184.desc: Pucker up for this big and juicy Vermont Valentine. A yellow orange embrace with a state load of floral aroma. Passionfruit sits front and centre, surrounded by notes of banana, tropical fruit, grapefruit and citrus. The juicy fruits ebb to a pronounced bitter finish.

185.name: Flux Factory
185.desc: Yuzu and bergamot flow into pine and grapefruit peel in this ever-changing West Coast IPA. This experimental pale utilises late hopping; delicate hop oils bring mango and lychee, running alongside toasty Crystal malt, with an underlying resinous bitterness bringing order to chaos.

186.name: Dead Empire
186.desc: Call the Imperial Guard for this hopped up superpower. Steele yourself for a Battle Royale bombardment of tropical fruit. Intense citrus, grapefruit, mango and resinous notes fight for supremacy. An Empire built on caramel foundations, culminating in a bitter finale. Game over.

187.name: Pudding Face
187.desc:
"Get your sticky fingers on this indulgent liquid cake. Inspired by the classic French chocolate éclair. Vanilla, chocolate and toffee aromas escape the Patisserie. Chocolate, toffee and roasted nuts layer up over chou pastry on the palate. Cascade hops add depth and balance out the delicious sweetness. Milk sugar and flaked oats ensure a piped smooth creamy delivery.

Pudding Face - Parlez vous chou?

188.name: Porridge Head
188.desc:
Oat and Milk Pale Ale

Part of the Fanzine club.

189.name: Jinx Pale Ale V1 - Washington Hop Edition
189.desc:
Fanzine release, Jinx will evolve with each release; the first celebrates Washington hop varieties.

A light biscuity base with a hint of toasty Munich malt acts as a simple canvas for the hops to shine. Dry-hopping with Washington hop varieties Simcoe and Centennial - two of our all-time favourites - provides a broad palate of pithy grapefruit and pungent pine.
Jinx - lift the Jinx and drink it.

190.name: Zwickel Helles
190.desc: Helles prototype brewed to celebrate the opening of BrewDog Berlin.

191.name: King of Eights V2 - Double Dry-Hop Edition
191.desc:
This juicy, smooth New England IPA has returned, and this time around we've double dry-hopped it and upped the ABV ever so slightly. Hopped with just Citra (but a lot of it), this hops takes the spotlight and shows exactly what it's capable of. 

Brewed for the Fanzine beer club.

192.name: Jet Trash V2 Double Dry Hop Edition
192.desc:
Firing on both engines, this double dry-hopped West Coast IPA packs a giant citrus and resinous pine and floral C-hop character unite over a deft touch of lightly roasted malt.



Brewed for the Fanzine beer club.

193.name: Ten Ton Truck - Espresso Edition
193.desc: An Oatmeal Espresso Stout with Cascade Hops and additions of Brown Sugar and Honey.

194.name: Hello My Name is Lieke
194.desc: Hello The Netherlands. My Name is Lieke. I'm a beer. A beer named by you and brewed exclusively for for you. This double IPA has a singular DNA. Infused with orange, this is a local beer with a global aspiration. Orange interplays with sweet tropical fruit and resinous hoppy notes. Sitting on a malty backbone and culminating in a dry bitter finish.

195.name: Transatlantic Telegram
195.desc:
Our Brewer built series showcases beers designed and chosen by our Brewers. A celebration of their creativity and craft. This was created and brewed by Patrick Robb.

Stand by to a receive a New England transmission. This full bodied juiced up NEIPA pours opaque orangey yellow. Pineapple, stone fruit and mango mix it up over a toffee malt base. Juicy sweetness is balanced by a moderate bitterness.
Transatlantic Telegram - Intercoastal haze.

A Fanzine beer.

196.name: Zephyr - V3 Pina Colada Edition
196.desc:
This Pina Colada-inspired sour session ale has deluge of aromas with pineapple, coconut and lime front and centre. Followed by a torrent of zesty citrus and light biscuit notes. A dry finish unpacks a symphony of sweet, sour and bitter.

Part of the Fanzine beer club

197.name: Elvis Hammer
197.desc:
The ultimate double act. Buddy up with this partnership of equals; two of our biggest hitters swinging in unison. The powerful citrus presence of Elvis pairs up with Jack, as aggressively resinous as ever. Intense lime peel, yuzu and lemon rind runs alongside pounding dry bitterness. Time to play Good Cop, Bitter Cop. 

Elvis Hammer - Hops joined at the hip.

198.name: Hazy AF
198.desc:
No alcohol just got juiced up. And Hazy AF lives up to the hype. All the attitude, all the flavour but none of the alcohol. Say hello to the juiciest alcohol free beer in town. Tropical fruits and grassy notes mix it up. Oats and wheat unite for a smoother ride. Full flavour, no alcohol, all out New England.

Contains lactose.

199.name: Casino Rye Ale
199.desc: We’ve split our bets with Casino Rye Ale and doubled up on the malt front, with barley and rye on the grain bill. Light caramel meets spicy toastiness, laying the groundwork for us to put all our chips on Equinox. Single-hopped with this new world variety, Casino Rye Ale is a cabaret of explosive pine, dry pithy orange, fresh grassy notes and prickly resin.

200.name: Straight Up
200.desc:
An un-cut Ahtanum IPA, showcasing a hop we use more than anyone else on planet earth. Straight up pine, grapefruit, pungent resin, stewed orange, lemongrass and warm peppery notes, supported by a medium dry body and a pale and recessive toasty malt presence.

Part of the Fanzine club

201.name: Red & Dead
201.desc:
Big, rounded and very much alive. This blood-red ale is sweet and fruity on the nose. Delivering berry, caramel and chocolate character by the coffin-load, with subtle notes of lychee, biscuit and a hint of spice. A red-caped marauder to steal your heart and hub caps.

Part of the Fanzine club

202.name: American Dream
202.desc: It's back to the future with this East Coast IPA. Classic dank and hoppy 90's Americana. Citrus and resin on the nose, accelerating into piney citrus notes, perfectly balanced by the biscuity caramel character. Culminating in a bitter finish. This is beer like it was, beer like it will be.

203.name: Mind Game
203.desc: An all-American line-up for this West Coast IPA - classic floral, citrus and resinous C-hop aromas bring mango, blood orange, pine dust, lemongrass, bergamot, and lemon oil in numbers. All sitting on a resinous, bold and bitter baseline with hints of toast and cinder toffee sneaking through the perimeter.

205.name: Himbeer Berliner Weisse
205.desc: Raspberry Berliner Weisse prototype brewed to celebrate the opening of BrewDog Berlin.

206.name: Zephyr - V1 Citrus Tart Edition
206.desc:
This tangy session pale ale has bags of citrus aroma and a juicy acidity on the palate. 
Brewed for the Fanzine beer club.

207.name: Zip Code
207.desc:
Lager with a Franconian accent. Our Kellerbier is unfiltered and naturally cloudy allowing a more complex yeast character. Toasty, rich and malty yet refreshingly crisp with a smooth mouthfeel.

Part of the Fanzine beer club.

208.name: Dry-Hopped Dortmunder Export
208.desc: Dortmunder prototype brewed to celebrate the opening of BrewDog Berlin.

209.name: Sonic Boom V2 - Experimental Hop IPA
209.desc:
Replacing our single hops series, this series of IPAs will allow out brew team to experiment with hops, with the base beer unchanging from release to release. 
New US experimental hop HBC 438 brings bags of floral and coconut character to this vibrant IPA, while stonefruit and citrus come courtesy of classic American dual purpose varieties. A twist of bitterness rounds out this engaging experimental IPA.

210.name: Hop Shop
210.desc:
A hop-heavy but beautifully balanced double IPA packed with 'c' hops and a dry finish.
Brewed for the Fanzine beer club.

211.name: Clouded Clarity
211.desc: Strike gold in the murky depths of this experimental lager. Biscuit notes from the malt character combine with a snap of floral and grassy hop bitterness. Delivering a smooth, juicy and full-bodied mouthfeel. A cloud with a golden lining - crisp, clean and cloudy.

212.name: Jaywalker
212.desc:
West Coast IPA

Part of the Fanzine club

213.name: Alpha Dog
213.desc:
A rock and roll medley of tropical fruit, berries and pine gives way to hints of roasted malt and a heady hoppiness, but with very low bitterness.

Brewed exclusive for our Norwegian market. It uses multiple malts and 2 distinct hops, Nelson Sauvin and Amarillo.

214.name: Scarlet Fever
214.desc: Citrus melds to the light noble hop aromas, with orange peel adding a twist of zest to the nose. Layers of dry spicy rye fuse with toasty caramel malt notes, giving subtle and complex grain flavours to this Red Rye Saison. Spice builds with the Saison yeast, a peppery undercurrent lies alongside clove, with hints of nutmeg and thyme.

215.name: Low Hanging Helles
215.desc:
This laid back lager has the lot. Clean and crisp throughout, it leans on a mix of US and EU hops layered onto a foundation of pilsner malt. The result is a quick fix of citrus and soft bready notes, suspended with substance below 3% ABV. Grab it and go.

Low Hanging Helles - Easy to reach.

Part of the BrewDog Fanzine

216.name: Nebula
216.desc:
Brewed with honey & brown sugar, Nebula packs notes of coffee, chocolate, and toffee.
Brewed for the Fanzine beer club.

218.name: Heist Monkey
218.desc:
Hands up for this full tilt Pale Ale. And prepare to be heisted by this hoppy protagonist. Aggressively dry-hopped with Mandarina, Citra and Centennial - this monkey means business. Citrus and pine hit home in volume, layered over a biscuity backbone. Then hold tight for the bitter finish.

Heist Monkey - stick it to the man.

Part of the Fanzine club.

219.name: Unleash The Yeast: American Ale
219.desc:
The unsung heroes, the foot soldiers of the revolution. We owe a huge debt to the billions of tiny yeast cells that work tirelessly to ferment sugars into alcohol and CO2. But yeast isn’t just here for the grunt work. Yeast has the power to change the flavour, aroma and complexion of your beer in an instant.

This series is designed to showcase the impact different yeasts have on the same base beer. This series of 4 beers gives the limelight to four totally different yeast strains: Belgian Trappist, Pilsen Lager, American Ale and Bavarian Weizen. All 4 beers have been brewed to the same ABV using a blend of Centennial and Amarillo hops and a backbone of Pale Ale, Munich and Cara Malts.

Malts:
Maris Otter, Crystal Malt, Caramalt

Hops:
Centennial, Amarillo

220.name: Small Batch: English IPA
220.desc:
An IPA using classic English hops that bring out floral and spicy notes in the beer.
Brewed for the Fanzine beer club

221.name: Off-Duty King
221.desc: Whisky and Rye barrel-ageing charge against the ramparts of seven malts and five hops.

222.name: Fool's Gold
222.desc:
A Munich helles malt profile of biscuit, cracker and toast, supports a spicy, herbal German Pils hop character. A snap of bitterness and a medium-light body give this classic golden pale lager a superb balance of malt and hops.
Fools Gold - Streik flüssiges Gold.

Brewed for the Fanzine beer club.

224.name: Closed Circuit
224.desc:
The West Coast is watching you.
Uninterrupted aromas of ripe mango, stewed orange, and pungent myrcene flow into flavours of lemon oil, resin, and hints of spicy hop. Locked down malt notes of cracker and biscuit. Get up close and personal for a long, dank, piney finish.

225.name: Interstate
225.desc:
Brewed with Vienna, Munich and Cara Red, hopped with Mandarina Bavaria. 
Brewed for the Fanzine beer club.

226.name: Humulus Helmsman
226.desc:
Set a course for the West Coast. American muscle flexes from the kettle to the whirlpool to the dry hopper. This golden yellow fellow is packing a giant tropical fruit cargo. The first wave of mango is quickly tailgated by citrus notes, subtle lemon and orange sherbet, with resinous pine hints, culminating in a moderate bitter long finish. 

Humulus Helmsman - new worlds await.

227.name: No Label
227.desc:
No Label is a postmodern, postgender non-binary brew; the world’s first beer made with transgender hops.

Brewed with whole hop bines that have spontaneously changed from female to male, no label goes its own way. The base style, Kölsch, blurs the boundaries between lager and ale, drawing comparisons to “non-binary” individuals who class themselves as neither exclusively male nor female.

No Label balances a light, biscuity dryness from the malt base with delicate hints of fruity esters gifted by the fermentation. Finally, dry-hopping adds a layer of new world tropical & pine flavours that add a unique twist to this classic Kölsch style beer.

A portion of the sales of this beer will be donated to LGBTQI+ events organisers Queerest of the Queer.

Malts: Munich, Pilsner, Wheat

Hops: Cascade, Jester, Mosaic

228.name: Grano Giusto
228.desc: This dark italian stallion of a lager is made with lokal Grano del Miracoli malt. Delivering full bodied notes of biscuit, nuts, coffee and dark sugar.

229.name: Hello My Name Is Sari
229.desc: Hello Finland My Name is Sari, I’m a beer. A beer named by you and brewed exclusively for you. This double IPA has a singular DNA. Infused with bilberry, this is a local beer with a global aspiration. Bilberry interplays with sweet tropical fruit and resinous hoppy notes. Sitting on a malty backbone and culminating in a dry bitter finish.

230.name: 10 Heads High
230.desc:
10 Heads High is loosely based on our awesome 2011 Prototype beer Hops Kill Nazis.

This is an uncompromising 7.7% Imperial Red Ale loaded high with American Hops. 

Think of this as an Imperial India Rd Ale, or a super-charged version of 5am Saint.

Either way this is a seriously good beer!

231.name: Hello My Name Is Marianne
231.desc: Hello France My Name is Marianne, I’m a beer. A beer named by you and brewed exclusively for you. This double IPA has a singular DNA. Infused with cassis, this is a local beer with a global aspiration. Cassis interplays with sweet tropical fruit and resinous hoppy notes. Sitting on a malty backbone and culminating in a dry bitter finish.

232.name: Sonic Boom V3 - Euro Hopped IPA
232.desc:
Welcome aboard our experimental range of Tuned IPAs. European hops of bergamot and rose, giving way to a fruit bombardment - countdown to strawberry, quince, pineapple, grape and lemon. Fresh grassy hop notes run alongside the mothership. All culminating in a trademark bitter boom finish.

Sonic Boom - IPA tuning at the speed of sound.

233.name: Off-Duty Alien
233.desc: A draft-only exclusive beer for international markets as part of the DogDealers programme. Off Duty Alien is a citrus IPA, brewed with blood orange and grapefruit to enhance the citrus characteristics of the hops.

236.name: Prototype Vienna Lager
236.desc:
A Prototype Vienna lager, brewed with loads of Vienna malt, speciality malts and one of our
favourite hops, Mandarina.

Toasty malt notes of bread crust, cheesecake base and cinder toffee, with a light orange peel hop character, and a
snappy medium dry finish.

237.name: Hello My Name Is Helga
237.desc: Hello Germany My Name is Helga, I’m a beer. A beer named by you and brewed exclusively for you. This double IPA has a singular DNA. Infused with cherry, this is a local beer with a global aspiration. Cherry interplays with sweet tropical fruit and resinous hoppy notes. Sitting on a malty backbone and culminating in a dry bitter finish.

238.name: Coconut Shy
238.desc:
Roll up, roll up. For an Imperialist extravaganza. Black as an Emperor’s heart. A fanfare of fun fair flavours. Aromas of coconut, chocolate and toffee unite. Brace yourself for the main event - a big coconut hit is rapidly followed by layers of dark chocolate and light roasty malt notes. Culminating in a sticky sweet full-bodied finale.
Coconut Shy - Take aim, fire.

239.name: Small Batch: Vermont IPA 4.0
239.desc:
Small batch brews are one-off beers from our pilot kit, or trial beers we have brewed with limited availability.

Pineapple, stonefruit, mango, light resin and hints of lime-peel. This juicy IPA is low in bitterness, full-bodied and smooth. Enhancing the soft ripe fruit flavours.

Malts: Pale, Wheat and Oats

Hops: Chinook, Amarillo, Simcoe, Citra and Mosaic.

Yeast: WLP4000 Vermont Ale

241.name: BA Radio Zombie Phone In
241.desc:
Barrel aged Equity for Punk exclusive.

Smooth talking, dark, and decadent-Imperialism goes digital. Aromas of roasted coffee and chocolate on the nose. With hints of pit fruits, chewy toffee, coffee, and dark chocolate on the palate. Finished late with American hops for a dash of bitterness.

242.name: Hello My Name Is Maria
242.desc: Hello Spain My Name is Maria, I’m a beer. A beer named by you and brewed exclusively for you. This double IPA has a singular DNA. Infused with mandarin, this is a local beer with a global aspiration. Mandarin interplays with sweet tropical fruit and resinous hoppy notes. Sitting on a malty backbone and culminating in a dry bitter finish.

243.name: Moshi Moshi 15
243.desc: This 5.2% complex yet unpretentious ale is our birthday salute to Moshi Moshi Records; at 15 years old they’re not old enough to drink it, but if they were, we know they’d love it as much as we do. A rich biscuity malt base takes the bassline, with the odd caramel pop and slap. Heavy hop riffs play on top; resinous resonance from the rhythm guitar, and the bitter notes we love so much on lead. That’s enough of the musical metaphors. Stick a record on, sit back, and enjoy this beer.

244.name: Nanny State (1.1% ABV)
244.desc: Nanny State is mild imperial ale containing more hops per barrel than any other beer ever brewed in the UK. It is an extraordinary little ale jammed full of all the brewer’s favourite hops giving it as much body and mouthy feel as possible, ensuring that low strength does not translate into reduced flavour. Nanny State, takes the low ABV hop-bomb concept to the next level and is so low in alcohol it is below the legal classification of beer and not strong enough to be subject to beer duty. We believe we have created a new beer category - The Imperial Mild - with Nanny State and How to Disappear Completely.

245.name: Zulu Time
245.desc:
Another day, another European collab... thank goodness! This time around saw us welcome Brasserie La Goutte d'Or from France. 

Apart from having an absolute blast with these guys we also had serious business to attend to... brew a beer that you're going to go crazy for, and we're pretty sure we nailed it.

We worked up a South African-themed stout brewed with the addition of Rooibos tea which was added into the whirlpool giving the beer an earthy, herby and floral character which plays off with the dark fruit and chocolate from the grains.

246.name: Declassified Demi-God
246.desc:
Barrel-aged Imperial milk stout

A full-on showcase of grain whisky barrel character, fused with the classic profile of Russian imperial stouts. A blend of two giant stouts, each loaded with flavors of intense espresso, bitter of chocolate, molasses, and roasted malt, each compounded with notes of smooth ganache, toasted oak, hints of vanilla and spice, balanced against an aggressive bitter edge. Full-bodied, bittersweet, and complex.

247.name: B Side: Protoköl
247.desc:
Here at BrewDog, we love the hidden tracks; the unexpected discoveries. The B-Sides.

Take our 10HL pilot kit. It is the place our brewers let those imaginations fly and lay down unpredictable, creative tracks. Our brew team use it to dial in our small-scale experimental brews, each then finding its way to our bars as a draught-only special release.

However, we felt the naming convention used previously – Pilot Brew XXX – didn't fully reflected the ingenuity displayed by our brewers. To depict this a little better we now release each pilot brew as a bona fide B-Side; alongside our production-batch launches that take place at our bars, you’ll be able to discover a flip side in the form of one of our B-Side releases.

After our first Kölsch-style ale (No Label) we are brewing another as a one-off keg only brew, and are going to get even more of the distinctive estery fruit flavours, traditional hop character and classic clean crispness these fascinating Cologne-style ales possess.

Northern Germany’s historic answer to the continent-sweeping rise of bottom-fermented lagers, conditioning on site at the moment we have the brand new Protoköl.

249.name: East of Vermont
249.desc: A Vermont IPA with mango, peach & lactose added, recreating fruity milkshake character in an IPA.

250.name: Small Batch: Imperial Pilsner
250.desc:
“My favourite beer in the world is Pivo Pils from Firestone Walker,” he says. “I consider it to be one of the most well-balanced beers in the world. As a brewer, I fully appreciate how difficult it is to make a truly good Pilsner and since this happens to be one of my favourite beer styles, my first thought was to take that up a notch and do one with true BrewDog style. Hence the Imperial Pilsner. This is a higher ABV, slightly edgier pilsner than Kingpin retaining the classic malt character of the style but I went ahead and dry hopped it with some new age German aroma hops.”

Jason used Magnum and Spalter in the boil but then added further additions of Callista into the whirlpool and then again at the dry-hop stage. Callista is a relatively new addition to the brewers’ arsenal, giving both a classically noble hop aroma and a welcoming flavour of citrus peel and juicy stonefruit. With the quintessential pilsner malt base and German lager yeast, his Pils is a revelation and rounds out at 6.0% ABV – it is going to be quite amazing on draft!

252.name: Small Batch: Dry-Hopped Pilsner
252.desc: A BrewDog bar exclusive draft lager, brewed with Weihenstephan’s lager yeast, and dry-hopped with the contemporary German variety Saphir; this lager has been lightly centrifuged and packaged at just under 28 days in tank.

253.name: Small Batch: Lemon Zephyr
253.desc:
LEMON. LIME. BISCUIT.
Lemon Zephyr is a slightly tart pale ale, packed with lemon character. Aromas of candied fruit and lemon bon-bons, followed by a sharp twist of citrus and a soft biscuity undertone on the palate.

254.name: Single Barrel #1770 - Absinthe Barrel-Aged Paradox
254.desc:
Paradox aged in Absinthe cask. Spicy star anise dominates the aroma with roasty dark chocolate and coffee flavours. Released for Brewdog's 2017 AGM in Aberdeen, Scotland and made an appearance at the Beavertown Extravaganza 2017.
The barrel number has been confirmed with BrewDog as 1770.

256.name: Blitz Saison
256.desc: A low alcohol, light, refreshing, effervescent, zippy and tarty Berliner Weisse which shines even brighter with the addition of fruit.

257.name: Small Batch: Tangerine Zephyr
257.desc:
TANGERINE. LEMON. BISCUIT.
Tangerine Zephyr is a slightly tart pale ale, with a huge citrusy aroma, and zingy notes of tangerine, lemon and lime on the palate.
Finishing light, it’s juicy and zesty, with a touch of biscuit malt to add a hint of sweetness to balance the tangy fruit.

258.name: B Side: Red Ale 2.0
258.desc:
Here at BrewDog, we love the hidden tracks; the unexpected discoveries. The B-Sides.

Take our 10HL pilot kit. It is the place our brewers let those imaginations fly and lay down unpredictable, creative tracks. Our brew team use it to dial in our small-scale experimental brews, each then finding its way to our bars as a draught-only special release.

However, we felt the naming convention used previously – Pilot Brew XXX – didn't fully reflected the ingenuity displayed by our brewers. To depict this a little better we now release each pilot brew as a bona fide B-Side; alongside our production-batch launches that take place at our bars, you’ll be able to discover a flip side in the form of one of our B-Side releases.

259.name: Franklinton Dumpster Fire
259.desc: Franklinton Dumpster Fire is a subtlely smoky Gose with tons of fire red raspberries. 3.5% ABV, tart, mouth puckering and deliciously tongue-in-cheek.

261.name: Wake Up Call AF
261.desc:
No alcohol just woke up. And Wake Up Call rises to the occasion. All the attitude, all the flavour but non of the alcohol. Say hello to the most rousing alcohol free beer in town. Subtle roast coffee notes are rounded out with milk sugar for a smooth delivery. Full flavour, no alcohol, wide awake.

Contains lactose.

262.name: Raspberry Popsicle Parade
262.desc:
0.5 % ABV Raspberry Berliner Weisse.
Juicy, tropical, fruit punch.

263.name: Small Batch: 90 Shilling
263.desc:
Our 10HL pilot kit is the place our brewers let their imaginations fly and lay down unpredictable, creative tracks. Our brew team use it to dial in our small-scale experimental brews, each then finding its way to our bars as a draught-only special release.

Malts: Extra Pale, Cara, Munich, Amber, Dark Roasted Crystal and Brown

Hops: Bramling Cross and First Gold

Yeast: Wyeast 1056 - American Ale

264.name: Small Batch: Blueberry Zephyr
264.desc:
BLUEBERRY.
This lightly tart and juicy pale ale evokes blueberry muffins with its fruity and soft malty aroma - followed by a lightly biscuity palate, finishing sharp and just sweet enough to balance the zingy fruit character.

265.name: Faux Fox Raspberry
265.desc:
An alcohol-free Berliner Weisse loaded with raspberries giving a fruity, light and tart explosion but with drinkability.

Contains lactose.

266.name: Export Alice Porter
266.desc:
This Export version of Alice Porter is available in the UK exclusively to our Equity Punks. In addition it is exported to Norway due to their 4.7% abv rule for beer in normal stores.

Weighing in at 4.6% ABV, Alice Porter hides a huge complexity behind her modest strength - it's roasty and smooth with a fruity, rich coffee character.

Alice Porter takes a sudden twist in an unexpected direction; a blend of hops that add a light, balancing citrusy twist and a subtle spiciness.

267.name: B Side: Sour Red Ale
267.desc:
Here at BrewDog, we love the hidden tracks; the unexpected discoveries. The B-Sides. 

Take our 10HL pilot kit. It is the place our brewers let those imaginations fly and lay down unpredictable, creative tracks. Our brew team use it to dial in our small-scale experimental brews, each then finding its way to our bars as a draught-only special release.

However, we felt the naming convention used previously – Pilot Brew XXX – didn't fully reflected the ingenuity displayed by our brewers. To depict this a little better we now release each pilot brew as a bona fide B-Side; alongside our production-batch launches that take place at our bars, you’ll be able to discover a flip side in the form of one of our B-Side releases.

268.name: Hello My Name Is Niamh
268.desc: Hello Ireland My Name is Niamh, I’m a beer. A beer named by you and brewed exclusively for you. This double IPA has a singular DNA. Infused with elderflower, this is a local beer with a global aspiration. Elderberry interplays with sweet tropical fruit and resinous hoppy notes. Sitting on a malty backbone and culminating in a dry bitter finish.

269.name: B Side: Helles
269.desc:
Here at BrewDog, we love the hidden tracks; the unexpected discoveries. The B-Sides.

Take our 10HL pilot kit. It is the place our brewers let those imaginations fly and lay down unpredictable, creative tracks. Our brew team use it to dial in our small-scale experimental brews, each then finding its way to our bars as a draught-only special release.

However, we felt the naming convention used previously – Pilot Brew XXX – didn't fully reflected the ingenuity displayed by our brewers. To depict this a little better we now release each pilot brew as a bona fide B-Side; alongside our production-batch launches that take place at our bars, you’ll be able to discover a flip side in the form of one of our B-Side releases.

271.name: Coconut & Yuzu IPA
271.desc: Lemony with a light coconut aroma

272.name: Small Batch: Peach & Apricot IPA
272.desc:
Small batch brews are one-off beers from our pilot kit, or trial beers we have brewed with limited availability.

Soft peach and apricot aromas combined with aromatic grass and pine notes. Mango and pineapple on the palate with a full rounded body.

273.name: Hello My Name Is Sofia
273.desc: Hello Italy My Name is Sofia, I’m a beer. A beer named by you and brewed exclusively for you. This double IPA has a singular DNA. Infused with regional ingredients, it is a local beer with a global aspiration. Made with lemon which interplays with sweet tropical fruit and resinous hoppy notes. Sitting on a malty backbone and culminating in a dry bitter finish.

274.name: Steve's Job "Dutch Drafts"
274.desc: Dutch Drafts, Kompaan Bier & Brewdog collaboration "smoked bba"

275.name: LIVE Black Hammer
275.desc:
Dark malt and American hops unite to bring a new age of bitterness. Pithy grapefruit and resin combine with a dark chocolate and roasty coffee hit to deliver a resonating bitterness that goes beyond IBUs.

LIVE beer is craft ale, conditioned in a key keg, gently sparkling and 100% awesome.

277.name: Small Batch: Mandarina Lager
277.desc:
Small batch brews are one-off beers from our pilot kit, or trial beers we have brewed with limited availability.

Malts: Pale and Pilsner

Hops: Magnum and Mandarina Bavaria

Yeast: Wyeast 2124 - Bohemian Lager

280.name: Maniac Insomniac
280.desc:
Dark as a Capuchin's robe and smoother than latte art. Our own coffee beans have lain recumbent in spirit barrels. Now, the long sleep is over. Intense coffee and vanilla on the nose. Silky coffee to taste with notes of dark chocolate, vanilla and spice. Wheat and oats allow a creamy smooth cappucino delivery.

Maniac Insomniac - better latte than never.

Designed and built exclusively for our Equity Punks by brewer Robert Cooke at our Ellon Brewery.

281.name: Small Batch: Dortmunder Lager
281.desc:
Our 10HL pilot kit is the place our brewers let their imaginations fly and lay down unpredictable, creative tracks. Our brew team use it to dial in our small-scale experimental brews, each then finding its way to our bars as a draught-only special release.

Malts: Pilsner and Extra Pale

Hops: Magnum and Sterling

Yeast: Wyeast 2124 - Bohemian Lager

284.name: Blitz Apricot Raspberry
284.desc: Made with a pale variety of raspberry called Apricot Raspberries.

285.name: Small Batch: Loral Lager
285.desc: Our 10HL pilot kit is the place our brewers let their imaginations fly and lay down unpredictable, creative tracks. Our brew team use it to dial in our small-scale experimental brews, each then finding its way to our bars as a draught-only special release.

286.name: Small Batch: Sidewalk Shark
286.desc: A light, effervescent German-style sour wheat beer; lemon peel, herbal lime leaf, notes of orange and a fresh bready malt base, with a pithy acidity and the refreshing addition of salt - enhancing the sweet and tart notes and rounding out the mouthfeel.

287.name: B Side: Raspberry Berliner Weisse
287.desc:
Here at BrewDog, we love the hidden tracks; the unexpected discoveries. The B-Sides.

Take our 10HL pilot kit. It is the place our brewers let those imaginations fly and lay down unpredictable, creative tracks. Our brew team use it to dial in our small-scale experimental brews, each then finding its way to our bars as a draught-only special release.

However, we felt the naming convention used previously – Pilot Brew XXX – didn't fully reflected the ingenuity displayed by our brewers. To depict this a little better we now release each pilot brew as a bona fide B-Side; alongside our production-batch launches that take place at our bars, you’ll be able to discover a flip side in the form of one of our B-Side releases.

288.name: Wake Up Call
288.desc: Roasty with notes of chocolate, dark berries, and a subtle nuttiness.

289.name: LIVE Dead Metaphor
289.desc:
LIVE version rebrew of an old recipe.
Scottish chocolate breakfast Stout - brewed with Brazilian coffee, Cacao and (for the Scottish element) oatmeal. Smooth, chocolatey and rich, with a honeycomb mouthfeel and a rich red berry coffee character.

290.name: Small Batch: Vienna Lager
290.desc:
Small batch brews are one-off beers from our pilot kit, or trial beers we have brewed with limited availability.

This 4.3% toasty Vienna Lager hides a spicy resinous bitter edge, while a blast of pithy orange and lemon peel balances the sweet bisvuity malt notes. Old world hops bring an extra layer of jasmine and rose charachter.

Malts: Pale, PIlsner, Munich, Amber and Cara

Hops: Perle, Hallertau Mittelfrüh and Mandarina Bavaria

Yeast: Wyeast 2124 - Bohemian Lager

291.name: Give Peach A Chance
291.desc:
As a reward for having our backs in Equity for Punks V, we invite you to find your inner self with this American IPA uplifted by the power of peach. Juicy, moreish stone fruit sweetness aligns the citrus and tropical chakras of US hops, in wave after wave of positive vibes. Peach out.

Give Peach a Chance – Go with the flow.

292.name: Blitz Blackberry
292.desc: A low alcohol, light, refreshing, effervescent, zippy and tarty Berliner Weisse which shines even brighter with the addition of fruit.

293.name: Small Batch: Callista Red Rye IPA
293.desc:
Small batch brews are one-off beers from our pilot kit, or trial beers we have brewed with limited availability. 

A red rye IPA brewed with a new German hop variety. Balancing juicy and pithy resinous bitterness perfectly, this Callista and Amarillo hopped IPA is packed with mango, kiwi, toffee, stonefruit, marmalade and spice.

Malts: Extra Pale, Rye, Crystal, Dark Crystal and Acidulated

Hops: Magnum, Calista and Amarillo

Yeast: Wyeast 1056 - American Ale

294.name: #CASK: Bracken's Porter
294.desc: A 5% robust and warming chocolate Porter. This beer was named Bracken's Porter as a tribute to our favourite four pawed friend who sadly passed away in 2013.

295.name: Small Batch: Sorachi Session Saison
295.desc:
Our 10HL pilot kit is the place our brewers let their imaginations fly and lay down unpredictable, creative tracks. Our brew team use it to dial in our small-scale experimental brews, each then finding its way to our bars as a draught-only special release.

Malts: Pale, Munich, Wheat, Rye and Acidulated

Hops: Sorachi Ace

Twist: Coriander Seed

Yeast: Wyeast 1388 Belgian Strong Ale

299.name: LIVE Alice Porter
299.desc:
A beer that has come and gone several times before is now back again LIVE!

Alice takes a sudden twist in an unexpected direction; a blend of hops that add a light, balancing citrusy twist and a subtle spiciness. This robust roasty porter has smooth and full-bodied mouthfeel while the addition of Sorachi Ace brings in a hint of vanilla alongside notes of citrus, spice and dark fruits.

300.name: Forbidden Brut
300.desc: Brut IPA with notes of peach and citrus.

302.name: Drive-By Donut
302.desc: Buckle up and accelerate into gooey oblivion. Chocolate and dark fruits on the nose. The up-front chocolate aroma is closely tailgated by hints of plum, subtle roasted coffee and vanilla flavors. A chesy mouthfeel and milk sugar allow super smooth transmission. Full-bodied, sweet and indulgent.

304.name: Blitz Lemon & Honey
304.desc: A low alcohol, light, refreshing, effervescent, zippy and tarty Berliner Weisse which shines even brighter with the addition of fruit.

305.name: 0.5% ABV Coffee Stout
305.desc: First trial batch of BrewDog coffee infused low-abv stout. First trialled at the BrewDog AGM 2019

306.name: Small Batch: Zephyr
306.desc: Zephyr is a light pale ale, with a twist of juicy acidity. Notes of Lemon, apple pie, and hints of light herbal spice are countered by a soft biscuity malt sweetness, in  straightforward and uncomplex crushable pale.

308.name: Bilingual Merman
308.desc: Copenhagen meets Columbus in this super fruit powered IPA. A spring-loaded, zesty IPA that delivers citrus aromas with lemon and pomegranate duking it out. The real lemon flavors are amplified by the hop profile, and the pomegranate juice adds tartness. All built on subtle malty caramel foundations, and crisp bitterness.

310.name: Emperor's Blue Clothes
310.desc:
Collab by People Like Us & BrewDog 
#UnfilterTheWorld
A blueberry hefeweizen with the aim to show that somethings in life are better unfiltered - hefeweizens and creativity.

312.name: Blitz Berliner Weisse
312.desc: A low alcohol, light, refreshing, effervescent, zippy and tarty Berliner Weisse which shines even brighter with the addition of fruit.

315.name: Crew Brew
315.desc: Brewed at BrewDog Columbus as a fundraiser for the campaign to purchase the Columbus Crew soccer team.

316.name: #CASK Russian Doll Pale Ale
316.desc: Pale, Cara and Dark Crystal malt create aromas and flavour from biscuit to caramel, toffee and treacle with citrus hops from Simcoe, Citra, Cascade and Centennial. This Pale Ale is zesty to tropical, yet stone fruit to jammy..

320.name: Redcurrant Popsicle Parade
320.desc: Alcohol-free redcurrant Berliner weisse. Small batch.

321.name: Small Batch: Kellerbier
321.desc:
Our 10HL pilot kit is the place our brewers let their imaginations fly and lay down unpredictable, creative tracks. Our brew team use it to dial in our small-scale experimental brews, each then finding its way to our bars as a draught-only special release.

Malts: Pilsner, Pale, Munich and Amber

Hops: Perle, Hallertauer Mittelfrüh and Mandarina Bavaria

Yeast: Wyeast 2124 - Bohemian Lager

323.name: Brut IPA
323.desc: Dry hopped with Citra, Mosaic, and Nelson Sauvin. Bone dry with notes of citrus, berries, and white grapes.

324.name: Sugar Daddy
324.desc:
Find your perfect partner in this rewarding stout, brewed with Muscovado and Milk Sugars for the sweetest of touches. The addition of cocoa nibs takes things to the next level, yielding full-bodied chocolate, warming caramel and dark fruit well into the finish. European hops add a touch of nobility and make this beer an ideal catch. Without our Equity Punks, none of what we have achieved would have been possible. This beer is your reward for having our backs. 
Sugar Daddy – A keeper.

326.name: Hello My Name Is (Unelected) Boris
326.desc:
At BrewDog we passionately believe in democracy and the British people's right to democratically elect our leader. 

We believe we should all get the vote for and elect who is in charge.

This belief is especially pertinent as our nation enters a particularly perilous chapter in our history. 

This 5.2% hazy East Coast style IPA is a liquid protest against unelected leaders and a beer to bring us all together in uncertain times.

328.name: Small Batch: Cherry Blossom
328.desc: Our 10HL pilot kit is the place our brewers let their imaginations fly and lay down unpredictable, creative tracks. Our brew team use it to dial in our small-scale experimental brews, each then finding its way to our bars as a draught-only special release.

329.name: Small Batch: Nitro Breakfast Stout
329.desc:
Our 10HL pilot kit is the place our brewers let their imaginations fly and lay down unpredictable, creative tracks. Our brew team use it to dial in our small-scale experimental brews, each then finding its way to our bars as a draught-only special release.

An utterly indulgent, smooth as hell Stout. With opulent flavours of chocolate milkshake, roasty espresso coffee, and mellow vanilla, this beer has a full-bodied and creamy mouthfeel.

Malts: Pale, Dark Crystal, Brown, Carafa I, Wheat and Oats

Hops: Magnum

Twist: Cacao, coffee, vanilla and lactose

Yeast: Wyeast 1272 - American Ale II

331.name: LIVE Hop Fiction
331.desc:
Hop Fiction LIVE 

A firm Chinook bitterness provides an underlying baseline of resin, on which is built fragrant floral and citrus notes of lime peel, grapefruit pith and bergamot, with subtle top notes of tropical fruit and berry. A light and simple malt base gives way to a long, pine-laden finish.

332.name: Hoppy Christmas (4.2%)
332.desc: In the true spirit of Christmas ’cheers’ we at BrewDog have taken it upon ourselves to create a Santa’s little helper for all those battling through the festive season. Our crack team of elves, penguins and red nosed reindeer have been crafting, brewing and perfecting this warming winter-IPA as a reward for all those driven to the brink and back in the name of Noel. Now all you have to do is don that customary yule tide sweater and find a roaring open fire to enjoy it by. In fact this beer is so good, we specifically advise against sharing it with any chimney intruding, night time visitors. Oh and just remember, this BrewDog’s not for life, it’s just for Christmas.

337.name: Heist Berry
337.desc: Complex layers of bold, dark fruity flavors intertwine with citrus and grassy notes, all underpinned with subtle hints of caramel and biscuit.

339.name: B Side: Rye IPA
339.desc:
Here at BrewDog, we love the hidden tracks; the unexpected discoveries. The B-Sides.

Take our 10HL pilot kit. It is the place our brewers let those imaginations fly and lay down unpredictable, creative tracks. Our brew team use it to dial in our small-scale experimental brews, each then finding its way to our bars as a draught-only special release.

However, we felt the naming convention used previously – Pilot Brew XXX – didn't fully reflected the ingenuity displayed by our brewers. To depict this a little better we now release each pilot brew as a bona fide B-Side; alongside our production-batch launches that take place at our bars, you’ll be able to discover a flip side in the form of one of our B-Side releases.

353.name: #CASK the Physics
353.desc:
A historically accurate beer based on the recipe devised on the 8th of February 2007 and rebrewed for #CASK in December 2019.

Recreated using the finest coloured malts which provide the complex sweet malt character which initially arouses the senses. Like a fine cheese cake the biscuit base has a smooth and creamy layer that both satisfies and entices. Culminating with a delicate fruit topping of blackcurrant and tinges of citrus to refresh the participant, complemented fully by the crisp dry bitter finish.

365.name: Small Batch: Amber Ale
365.desc:
Small batch brews are one-off beers from our pilot kit, or trial beers we have brewed with limited availability.

Caramel and toffee malt balanced with tropical and resinous new world hops and a light bitterness.

Malts: Pale, Crystal, Dark Crystal, Carafa and Dextrin

Hops: Mosaic, Equinox, Mandarina Bavaria and Hallertau Blanc

Yeast: Wyeast 1056 - American Ale

367.name: Single Barrel #1373
367.desc: A beer/mead hybrid we brewed on the pilot kit back in 2015, aged for almost three years in Viognier white wine barrels. The recipe was never added to our filing system.

368.name: Dogland
368.desc: Collab between Land-Grant Brewing and Brewdog.

371.name: Death Valley Disco
371.desc:
This beer was brewed by; Steven Benson, Kim Rickwood, Neil Rowe, Patrick Boerkamp, Nick Blewer

As a reward for having our backs in Equity for Punks V, we invite you to strut proudly into the world's hottest club for this DDH IPA, with hops direct from the US of A. Tropical fruit, mango and citrus rise mirage-like from the strobe-lit salt flats as a punchy bitterness reanimates in time for another shimmy across the dance floor. Death Valley Disco - care to dance?

378.name: Single Barrel #132
378.desc: Our red-rye IPA, Albino Squid Assassin, barrel-aged in rye - a rebrew of our most requested barrel-aged beers.

379.name: Cloud 9
379.desc:
Brewed to celebrate the world's first craft beer airlines 2nd flight, this beer is best enjoyed at altitude. As pale and hazy yellow as a transatlantic sun rise. Brace brace for a full-tilt fruit hit. Mango , pineapple, stone-fruit, and a hint of lime head for the skies. Brewed with oats and wheat and left unfiltered for a smoother crossing. November echo India papa Alfa you are clear for take off. 
Cloud 9 juicy Jet.
